dublinCore.dc:title: 109 HR 3337 IH: To amend title 49, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to extend a requirement for the prescreening of air passengers to international flights that overfly the United States.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Fitzpatrick of Pennsylvania (for himself and Mr. DeFazio) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to extend a requirement for the prescreening of air passengers to international flights that overfly the United States.

subsection.text: Section 44909(c)(6)(A) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting after international flight to or from the United States the following , and for any international flight that overflys the United States,.
Section 44909(c)(6) of such title is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: In this subsection, the following definitions apply:

clause.header: International flight that overflys the United States
clause.text: The term international flight that overflys the United States means any flight departing from a place outside the United States that transits the territorial airspace of the United States en route to a place outside the United States.

clause.header: Territorial airspace of the united states
clause.text: The term territorial airspace of the United States means the airspace over the United States and the airspace overlying the territorial waters between the United States coast and 12 nautical miles from the United States coast.

subsection.text: Not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Homeland Security, or a designee of the Secretary, shall issue a notice of proposed rulemaking to carry out the amendments made by this section.
